other_tests.findings: Conductive hearing loss in the left ear, with a speech-reception threshold of 20 dB. Mixed hearing loss in the left ear: purely conductive below 4000 Hz and mostly sensorineural above that frequency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: On follow-up 3 weeks later, speech-reception threshold was in the 35-dB range; other findings were unchanged.

other_tests.findings: Flat tympanogram indicating decreased mobility of the ear drum, consistent with the presence of fluid in the middle ear.
Described as a procedure; specific findings not detailed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: On follow-up 3 weeks later, abundant debris was found and removed from the left ear canal; dried serous material covered the left tympanic membrane.

other_tests.findings: Hyperdense soft-tissue mass, 3.2 cm by 2.5 cm by 4 cm, against the lateral aspect of the left mastoid bone, narrowing the lumen of the external auditory canal.
other_tests.changes_over_time: One month later, MRI showed the mass had increased in size, now entirely filling and obliterating the lumen.

other_tests.procedure_name: MRI of the brain and temporal bone
other_tests.findings: Enhancing soft-tissue mass, 4.5 cm by 2.8 cm by 4.5 cm, in the periauricular region, with opacification of the left mastoid air cells.
Cellular neoplasm composed of large dyshesive myeloid cells, confirming diagnosis of myeloid sarcoma.
